headline.main: The Free Academy--How its Usefulness can be Increased.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the N. Y. Daily Times: SIR: The Free Academy, as you are aware, has existed nearly six years. The general success that has crowned its efforts, reflects honor on its Board of Managers, and on those whose services are devoted to the Institution.

docs.lead_paragraph: Some Further Remarks on the Article in Putnam's Magazine. I have been favored with many suggestions within a few days, implying that it, was best to let the ladies alone, by which I understand that it is thought best to let the gentlemen do all the writing and talking about them.

docs.lead_paragraph: A writer in the San Francisco Golden Era gives the history of a certain wooden building near the corner of Washington and Stockton-streets, built in 1849, and makes the following startling developments about its former proprietor.: As we before said, the individual who built that house was by profession a gambler, by the name of H--.

headline.main: THIRTY-THIRD CONGRESS......First Session.; SENATE. HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. BADGER presented the proceedings of the Convention held at Wilmington, N. C., and presided over by the Governor of the State, in relation to the improvement of Cape Fear River. Mr. JOHNSON, from the Committee on Printing, re ported adversely on printing 1,000 additional copies of SANDFORD'S Reports on the Penal Codes of Europe, and on the administrative changes in France since 1848.

docs.lead_paragraph: The examination in the Fugitive Slave Case--if he is a slave, and if he is a fugitive--at Boston, was yesterday concluded. The decision will be rendered on Friday. Till that time, expectation, which has so long stood on tiptoe, will settle down to a cushioned seat and wait.
